test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System continuously monitors temperature in all GMP storage areas as specified in URS-EMS-001.

test_steps.action: Set up temperature sensors in GMP storage areas.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are displayed on the system interface.

test_steps.action: Monitor temperature readings for 24 hours.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are continuous and recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be stored in vendor's standard database format.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as specified in URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set temperature setpoint to 25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it on the interface.

test_steps.action: Simulate temperature deviation to 27°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert for temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: System generates alerts within 30 seconds of temperature deviation.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be stored in vendor's standard database format.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS accurately measures and records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.

test_steps.action: Place the reference temperature sensor and EMS probe in a controlled environment set to 25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature reading within 24.5°C to 25.5°C.

test_steps.action: Repeat the test at -20°C and +40°C using the same methodology.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS readings remain within ±0.5°C of reference values at all test points.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of reference values
System maintains accuracy across full operational range
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for accurate data recording
data_integrity_requirements: All test data must be automatically recorded in the system audit trail
No manual data entry permitted during testing

test_cases.objective: Verify that temperature deviation alarms properly trigger notifications through the integrated paging system.
prerequisites: EMS fully configured with alarm thresholds
Test recipient designated for alarm notifications

test_steps.action: Set temperature alarm threshold to 25°C with ±2°C deviation limits.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts and saves alarm configuration.

test_steps.action: Simulate temperature excursion to 27.1°C using test mode.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS triggers alarm within 30 seconds and notification appears on paging system.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm triggers within 30 seconds of excursion
Notification appears on paging system within 1 minute
All events recorded in audit trail
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm events must be time-stamped in the audit trail
Notification logs must match system records

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 5°C in the system configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it correctly.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 7.5°C (exceeding +2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 2.5°C (exceeding -2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated for both +2°C and -2°C deviations
Alerts are generated within 30 seconds
Alert messages are clear and actionable
data_integrity_requirements: Alert records must include timestamp, sensor ID, and deviation value
Alerts must be stored in the audit trail

test_cases.objective: Verify successful integration between EMS and facility management system using standard protocols.
prerequisites: Both systems are installed and operational
Network connectivity between systems is established

test_steps.action: Configure EMS to send test data to facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: Configuration is accepted without errors.

test_steps.action: Generate a test temperature reading in EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Reading appears in facility management system within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Generate a test alert in EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Alert notification appears in facility management system within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: All test data is accurately transferred between systems
Data transfer occurs within 30 seconds
No data corruption occurs during transfer
data_integrity_requirements: Transferred data must match source data exactly

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C in the system configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it correctly.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 27.1°C (exceeding +2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 22.9°C (exceeding -2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated for both +2°C and -2°C deviations
Alerts are generated within 30 seconds of deviation
Alert messages contain correct temperature values
data_integrity_requirements: Alert records must be complete and unaltered

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system properly retains and archives data for the required 7-year period.

test_steps.action: Generate test data records with timestamps spanning 7 years in the past.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts all test data records.

test_steps.action: Verify all test records are accessible through the archival interface.
test_steps.expected_result: All records are retrievable with correct data.

test_steps.action: Attempt to delete any record older than 7 years.
test_steps.expected_result: System prevents deletion of records within retention period.

acceptance_criteria: All records within 7-year period are retained
Archived data is complete and unaltered
System prevents premature deletion of records
regulatory_basis: EU GMP Annex 11 for data integrity
data_integrity_requirements: Records must be complete and unaltered

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS integrates seamlessly with the existing facility management system using standard protocols.

test_steps.action: Configure EMS to interface with the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS successfully connects to the facility management system.

test_steps.action: Send a test data packet from EMS to the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data packet is received and processed by the facility management system.

acceptance_criteria: EMS integrates with the facility management system without errors.
Data packets are successfully transmitted and processed.

test_cases.test_name: Alarm Notification Integration with Paging System
test_cases.objective: Ensure that alarm notifications from EMS are correctly integrated with the site paging system using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Configure EMS to send alarm notifications to the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS successfully connects to the site paging system.

test_steps.action: Trigger a test alarm in EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is received and broadcasted by the site paging system.

acceptance_criteria: EMS integrates with the site paging system without errors.
Alarm notifications are successfully broadcasted.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure alarm data integrity during transmission.
